text.section:
A member or employee of a board of supervisors for a soil conservation district is immune from suit in courts of the State and from liability in tort for a tortious act or omission:
That is within the scope of the public duties of the member or employee;
That is made without malice or gross negligence; and
For which the soil conservation district has consented to suit under subsection (b) of this section, even if damages exceed the limits of that consent.

section.section: The exclusive remedy for a tortious act or omission, for which a member or employee of a board of supervisors for a soil conservation district is immune from suit or liability under subsection (a) of this section, is a suit brought against the appropriate soil conservation district.
The soil conservation district may not assert the defense of governmental immunity in any suit brought under this section.

text.section:
The State Insurance Program administered under Title 12 of the State Government Article for purposes of providing coverage under the Maryland Tort Claims Act shall:
Govern the limits of liability in any suit brought under this section; and
Provide funds for the payment of any settlement or judgment entered against the soil conservation district in a suit brought under this section.
